t: How*pn you have helped the powerless and*ln delivered the arm that is weak!
How*ln you have counseled the unwise and*ln abundantly provided insight!
With*ln whom did you speak these words? Whose*ln breath came out of your mouth?
The*pn departed spirits tremble beneath*ln the waters and all that inhabit them.
Sheol*ln is naked before God, and*ln Abaddon has no covering.
He*pn stretches the northern skies over empty space; he*ln hangs the earth on nothing.
He*ln wraps up the water in his clouds, yet*ln the clouds do not burst beneath its weight.
He*ln obscures the view of his throne, spreading*ln his cloud over it.
He*ln laid out the horizon on the surface of the waters at*ln the boundary between light and darkness.
The*ln pillars that hold up the sky tremble, astounded*ln at his rebuke.
By*ln his power he stirred the sea, and*ln by his understanding he crushed Rahab.
By*pn his breath the heavens gained their beauty; his*ln hand pierced the fleeing serpent.
These*ln are but the fringes of his ways; how*ln faint is the word we hear of him! Who*ln can understand his mighty thunder?
